metadata.title: CVE-2024-35958 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: ena: Fix incorrect descriptor free behaviorENA has two types of TX queues:- queues which only process TX packets arriving from the network stack- queues which only process TX packets forwarded to it by XDP_REDIRECT  or XDP_TX instructionsThe ena_free_tx_bufs() cycles through all descriptors in a TX queueand unmaps + frees every descriptor that hasn't been acknowledged yetby the device (uncompleted TX transactions).The function assumes that the processed TX queue is necessarily fromthe first category listed above and ends up using napi_consume_skb()for descriptors belonging to an XDP specific queue.This patch solves a bug in which, in case of a VF reset, thedescriptors aren't freed correctly, leading to crashes.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
